command.name: _complete
command.help:
Internal command to provide shell completion suggestions

Options:
--shell(-s)The shell type ("bash", "fish", "zsh")
--input(-i)An array of input tokens (e.g. COMP_WORDS or argv)
--current(-c)The index of the "input" array that the cursor is in (e.g. COMP_CWORD)
--api-version(-a)The API version of the completion script
--symfony(-S)deprecated
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question

option.name: --input
option.help: An array of input tokens (e.g. COMP_WORDS or argv)

option.name: --current
option.help: The index of the "input" array that the cursor is in (e.g. COMP_CWORD)

option.name: --api-version
option.help: The API version of the completion script

option.name: --help
option.help: Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: completion
command.help:
The completion command dumps the shell completion script required
to use shell autocompletion (currently, bash, fish, zsh completion are supported).

Static installation
-------------------

Dump the script to a global completion file and restart your shell:

Z:/_projekts/private_projekte_2024/cli_pool/bin/console completion | sudo tee /etc/bash_completion.d/console

Or dump the script to a local file and source it:

Z:/_projekts/private_projekte_2024/cli_pool/bin/console completion > completion.sh

# source the file whenever you use the project
source completion.sh

# or add this line at the end of your "~/.bashrc" file:
source /path/to/completion.sh

Dynamic installation
--------------------

Add this to the end of your shell configuration file (e.g. "~/.bashrc"):

eval "$(Z:\_projekts\private_projekte_2024\cli_pool\bin\console completion )"

Options:
--debugTail the completion debug log
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question

option.name: --help
option.help: Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: help
command.help:
The help command displays help for a given command:

Z:/_projekts/private_projekte_2024/cli_pool/bin/console help list

You can also output the help in other formats by using the --format option:

Z:/_projekts/private_projekte_2024/cli_pool/bin/console help --format=xml list

To display the list of available commands, please use the list command.

Options:
--formatThe output format (txt, xml, json, or md)
--rawTo output raw command help
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question

option.name: --format
option.help: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

option.name: --help
option.help: Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: list
command.help:
The list command lists all commands:

Z:/_projekts/private_projekte_2024/cli_pool/bin/console list

You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:

Z:/_projekts/private_projekte_2024/cli_pool/bin/console list test

You can also output the information in other formats by using the --format option:

Z:/_projekts/private_projekte_2024/cli_pool/bin/console list --format=xml

It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):

Z:/_projekts/private_projekte_2024/cli_pool/bin/console list --raw

Options:
--rawTo output raw command list
--formatThe output format (txt, xml, json, or md)
--shortTo skip describing commands' arguments
--help(-h)Display help for the given command. When no command is given display help for the list command
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug
--version(-V)Display this application version
--ansiForce (or disable --no-ansi) ANSI output
--no-ansiNegate the "--ansi" option
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question
